byline.contributor: Niki Kitsantonis and Dimitris Bounias contributed reporting.

abstract: Concerns are growing about Greece’s ability, and willingness, to trim its public work force, army of patronage that is protected by its political power; cuts to government jobs are crucial element in bringing expenses under control enough to win continued international financing.
snippet: Concerns are growing about Greece’s ability, and willingness, to trim its public work force, an army of patronage that is protected by its political power.
lead_paragraph: Concerns are growing about Greece’s ability, and willingness, to trim its public work force, an army of patronage that is protected by its political power.

headline.main: Bureaucracy in Greece Defies Efforts to Cut It
headline.print_headline: Bureaucracy in Greece Defies Efforts to Cut It
headline.seo: Greece’s Bloated Bureaucracy Defies Efforts to Cut It
